title: No ping fluctuations, but I still get "Attempting to Reconnect" and DC from the game?
body:
This started happening about a month ago, I'm just playing a few games of League with my friends, when suddenly I get "Attempting to Reconnect." I can still hear my friends just fine over Skype, they can hear me just fine with no issues. Browser works too. 

At first I thought it was just a little issue that happened occasionally, but now it happens every game at LEAST 3-5 times. This is starting to really piss me off and annoy me, since this has now become a cause for me losing Ranked games since I DC in the middle of the fight or I'm splitting and about to start heading back to base when I get "Attempting to Reconnect."

A couple of my friends have been saying that other people have been having problems like this too, and that it happens when we drop just one packet in our connection to the Riot servers, after hearing this I can kind of see why my ping doesn't change when it happens, but seriously ONE PACKET?!

If anyone knows any fix to this, then please let me know, I am honestly sick and tired of this issue. 
(I am playing on a desktop and am using Wi-Fi since an Ethernet cord can't reach my room.)

replies.body: It sounds like your network has been gradually weakening and has exasperated into a consistent issue.  You can get an overview of your connection strength and packet loss by running a[ log reader](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743-Connection-Troubleshooting-Log-Reader), if you are having any doubts.  Your best bet would be to go through the steps in our [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to fix this up for good.  Hopefully, this will give you the tools to get you back in-game without issue!

I did a ping test, pinging www.google.com 1000 times. 

Ping statistics for 2607:f8b0:4002:c07::69:
    Packets: Sent = 1000, Received = 100, Lost = 0 (0% loss),
Approximate round trip times in milli-seconds:
    Minimum = 47ms, Maximum = 153ms, Average = 52ms

Either my problem is solved and I'm losing no more packets, or I don't know what else.

I looked at the logs, and it said I had an average of ~5% packet loss during the duration of the disconnections .
This has started happening to me also, I've been using a wireless adapter for my Desktop for ~6 months. I still don't get how I could still talk and hear my friends on skype, with no fluctuations.
